system.description: Automatically equipped in each empty hand slot.

summary.value: What we seek is to help people, not words of appreciation.

system.description:
ALSO: Champion, Chosen One, Savior

Often written in legends, a Hero is the embodiment of light and hope in a land plagued by darkness and despair. Together with their fellow companions, heroes travel the world seeking to help people in need and defeat forces of evil. Their only true reward, is maybe one day being remembered by those whose lives they impacted.

HERO FREE BENEFITS

  • Permanently increase your maximum Hit Points by 5.

  • Gain the ability to equip martial shields, and choose one: gain the ability to equip martial melee weapons; or gain the ability to equip martial ranged weapons.

HERO SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.MCrVhNlP4jbzdJi6]{A Hero's Purpose} (SL3)

Once per session, when you save one or more NPCs from danger, complete a quest for one or more NPCs, or one or more Villains reach 0 Ultima Points while you are present on the scene, you gain 【SL】 Fabula Points.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.4NcCRrGyuuOrgI8J]{It Was Destiny}

Once per session, you may spend a Fabula Point to create a new Bond towards someone or something, or add an emotion to one of your existing Bonds; this doesn’t require an action, but during a conflict it can only be done on your turn, while no effect is being resolved. Explain how destiny affected your relationships!

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.qg39quSjbKuvHLPo]{Power Of Friendship} (SL2)

You gain a number of extra Bond slots equal to 【SL】 .

Additionally, when you invoke a Bond to improve the Accuracy Check of an attack, that attack deals extra damage equal to 【the strength of that Bond】 .

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.iIBms0agbwthfoEz]{Resolve} (SL5)

During a conflict, you may use an action and spend a Fabula Point to recover from all status effects and also recover 【10 + (SL x 10)】 Mind Points.

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-skills.Item.89brp9KWRYdJlvgZ]{Ties That Bind} (SL5)

When you invoke a Bond, you may choose an ally present on the scene: they recover 【SL x 4】 Hit Points or Mind points (your choice). If the Bond you invoked is with the ally you chose, that ally instead recovers both 【SL x 4】 it Points and Mind Points.

HEROIC SKILLS

“Mastery of the Hero Class” is included in the Requirements of the following existing Heroic Skills: Disarming Rhetoric, Heroic Companion, and Unbreakable (Core Rulebook, pages 235, 236 and 240, respectively), Arcane Soldier (Techno Fantasy Atlas, page 171), and Brave Bash and Cheer Up! (Natural Fantasy Atlas, page 163).

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-heroic-skills.Item.lrhl1WGyjTLvgV3B]{Fabula Impetum}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-heroic-skills.Item.DmzhRK2b6wNM1MKN]{Heroic Aura}

@UUID[Compendium.fabula-ultima-homebrew.homebrew-heroic-skills.Item.V5zFlTpLppmjoXuZ]{Making Legend}

CREDIT

Class Design, Writing and Development Tails (@tailspr)

Layout by Ophan, based on the official Fabula Ultima layout by Emanuele Galletto

summary.value: Words are only as good as they actions that follow them.

system.description:
ALSO: Ambassador, Diplomat, Entertainer

Some are graceful and ever smiling, others are subtle and witty: Orators are as good at reading someone’s heart as they are at rounding up allies for their cause, sometimes unintentionally. The words of an Orator may rekindle spirits or plunge their opponents into despair: over the centuries, some Orators’ talents have brought entire nations to ruin… and just as many have granted fallen kingdoms a chance to rise from their very ashes.

ORATOR FREE BENEFITS
  • Permanently increase your maximum Mind Points by 5.

ORATOR SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.DtEiCkDsC1amYABn]{Condemn} (SL4)

You may use an action and spend 5 Mind Points to perform an Opposed 【INS + WLP】 Check against a creature that can hear and understand you — describe your accusations! If you succeed, the target loses 【SL × 10】 Mind Points and suffers dazed or shaken (your choice).

You gain a bonus equal to 【SL】 to your 【INS + WLP】 Checks for this Skill.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.04DiGVKhF3DtmJ4n]{Encourage} (SL6)

During a conflict, you may use an action and spend 5 Mind Points to choose another creature that can hear and understand you. That creature recovers 【SL × 5】 Hit Points and chooses Dexterity, Insight, Might, or Willpower: they treat the chosen Attribute as being one die size higher (up to a maximum of d12) until the start of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.lK9onKSiMuQEe3zd]{My Trust In You} (SL2)

After another Player Character who is able to hear you performs a Check, you may spend 1 Fabula Point and invoke one of their Traits or Bonds in order to let them reroll dice or improve the Result of the Check (following the normal rules). Then, if you have a Bond towards that character, they recover 【SL × 10】 Mind Points.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.GjmqoWAJ4szsk0om]{Persuasive} (SL2)

When you successfully perform a Check to fill or erase sections of a Clock, if your approach relied on charm, diplomacy, deception or intimidation, you may spend up to 【SL × 20】 Mind Points. If you do, fill or erase an additional section of that Clock for every 20 Mind Points you spend this way.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.ucCrtRAvv2qX8aJO]{Unexpected Ally}

You may use an action and spend 1 Fabula Point to choose a non-hostile creature able to hear and understand you. If you do, that creature becomes helpful towards you so long as you are kind and respectful to them and your requests are reasonable.

summary.value: Borders are a trick of the mind.

system.description:
ALSO: Adventurer, Explorer, Treasure Hunter

Nomads searching for a fabled continent, explorers braving the wilds, grizzled hunters and travelers have one thing in common: they are Wayfarers. While a majority of heroes travel the world during their adventures, Wayfarers live for the journey. They are always eager to visit new places and learn from others. In the eyes of a Wayfarer, the wilderness is neither foe nor an ally, but rather a stern teacher who can reveal many forgotten truths.

WAYFARER FREE BENEFITS
  • Permanently increase your maximum Inventory Points by 2.

WAYFARER SKILLS

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.L34pOGhdH0ZwV4Bt]{Faithful Companion} (SL5)

Together with your group, create a level 5 beast, construct, elemental or plant NPC (see Core Rulebook, page 302), that becomes your companion: this creature has no initiative score and does not level up, can have a maximum of two basic attacks, gains a bonus equal to 【SL】 to Accuracy Checks and Magic Checks, and their maximum Hit Points are equal to 【(SL, multiplied by the companion's base Might size) + half your level】.

Your companion doesn't get an independent turn during conflicts, but you can use an action to have them perform an action (once per turn). If your companion is affected by any turn-related effects (see Core Rulebook, page 77), these are based on your turn.

Your companion joins and leaves scenes when you do, and gains your same benefits for rests. If reduced to 0 HP, your companion flees the scene and rejoins you at the start of the next scene in which you are present, with current HP equal to their Crisis score.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.0n8T7U81oNP7yU5X]{Resourceful} (SL4)

You recover 【SL】 Inventory Points after each travel roll (see Core Rulebook, page 106).

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.CHMsojkTh3fU8HXg]{Tavern Talk} (SL3)

When you rest inside an inn or tavern, you may ask the Game Master up to 【SL】 questions about your surroundings and the people who live here; the Game Master will answer truthfully and you describe how you gathered the information.

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.rsGhkElIiEBgN5zA]{Treasure Hunter} (SL2)

When your group journeys on the world map, you will make a discovery on a roll of 【SL + 1】 or lower on the travel roll (instead of only on a 1).

@UUID[Compendium.projectfu.skills.Item.fuPzuDHzaKUgbvL2]{Well-Traveled}

You reduce the die rolled for your travel rolls by one size (to a minimum of d6).

If multiple characters have this Skill, the effects are not cumulative.

Once per session, when you save one or more NPCs from danger, complete a quest for one or more NPCs, or one or more Villains reach 0 Ultima Points while you are present on the scene, you gain 【SL】 Fabula Points.

  • You Gain: @GAIN[$sl fp]{SL FP}

During a conflict, you may use an action and spend 5 MP to choose another creature that can hear and understand you. That creature recovers 【SL × 5】 Hit Points and chooses Dexterity, Insight, Might, or Willpower; they treat the chosen Attribute as being one die size higher (up to a maximum of d12) until the start of your next turn.

  • Target Recovers: @GAIN[5*$sl hp]{SL × 5 HP}

  • Target Receive: @EFFECT[dex-up e:sot i:1 t:source], @EFFECT[ins-up e:sot i:1 t:source], @EFFECT[mig-up e:sot i:1 t:source], or @EFFECT[wlp-up e:sot i:1 t:source]

After another Player Character who is able to hear you performs a Check, you may spend 1 Fabula Point and invoke one of their Traits or Bonds in order to let them reroll dice or improve the Result of the Check (following the normal rules). Then, if you have a Bond towards that character, they recover 【SL × 10】 Mind Points.

  • Target Recovers: @GAIN[10*$sl mp]{SL × 10 MP}

Together with your group, create a level 5 beast, construct, elemental or plant NPC (see Core Rulebook, page 302), that becomes your companion: this creature has no initiative score and does not level up, can have a maximum of two basic attacks, gains a bonus equal to 【SL】 to Accuracy Checks and Magic Checks, and their maximum Hit Points are equal to 【(SL, multiplied by the companion's base Might size) + half your level】.

Your companion doesn't get an independent turn during conflicts, but you can use an action to have them perform an action (once per turn). If your companion is affected by any turn-related effects (see Core Rulebook, page 77), these are based on your turn.

Your companion joins and leaves scenes when you do, and gains your same benefits for rests. If reduced to 0 HP, your companion flees the scene and rejoins you at the start of the next scene in which you are present, with current HP equal to their Crisis score.

  • To automate, import the following actor into the world: @UUID[Compendium.projectfu.npcs.Actor.7J6fSVwbaWwi3Ojv]{Faithful Companion}

  • Then, navigate to the 'Settings' tab. For 'Player,' select the actor who owns this companion, and for 'Skill,' select the 'Faithful Companion' skill.

When you rest inside an inn or tavern, you may ask the Game Master up to 【SL】 questions about your surroundings and the people who live here; the Game Master will answer truthfully and you describe how you gathered the information.

This weapon possesses the modifications of Accurate, Defense Boost, and Powerful.

See Custom Weapons for details.

summary.value: This allows the entire group to rest in the wilderness and at sea.

system.description: For 4 Inventory Points, this allows the entire group to rest in the wilderness and at sea.

summary.value: One creature suffers 10 damage of a type of your choice (10 Air, 10 Bolt, 10 Earth, 10 Fire, or 10 Ice).

system.description:
For 2 Inventory Points, one creature suffers 10 damage of a type of your choice (air, bolt, earth, fire, or ice).

  • Target Suffers: @DMG[10 air], @DMG[10 bolt], @DMG[10 earth], @DMG[10 fire], or @DMG[10 ice]

summary.value: One creature recovers from a single status effect.

system.description: For 2 Inventory Points, one creature recovers from a single status effect.
For 3 Inventory Points, one creature recovers @HEAL[50 mp].
For 3 Inventory Points, one creature recovers @HEAL[50 hp].
